txt.en: 'What do the Elves wish to speak with us about?'
'Aye, this would be acceptable. It has been long since any of my people ventured past the eaves.'
'It is good to see you both, my friends. It has been far too long, and much has kept me away from Laerlad.'
'Travel safe, friends.'
'I have summoned you here on the behalves of Celeborn and Thranduil.'
'They wish to speak with you about these woods. They should be arriving at any moment.'
Instance: The Gift of Greenleaves
'Ah, here they are!'
'It has been a long while since last we saw you at Rhosgobel.'
'I agree with Ríkmar. Where are these Elves then?'
'We have lived in these woods for many years. This is our home and sanctified claim upon them would be an honour.'
'We thank you.'
'It is good of all of you to meet us here at the Narrows of the Mirkwood.'
'Radagast, I thank you for hosting us at Rhosgobel.'
'Now, as you may be aware, the War is over, and Dol Guldur has been broken and laid bare.'
'The darkness of the Mirkwood has been halted. With this we wish to reclaim the Mirkwood.'
'Knowing that the War was over, King Thranduil set out for the south.'
'We desire to involve you, the Woodmen, in this claim.'
'Good, then I shall claim the southern wood.'
'From this moment forward the Mirkwood shall now be known as Eryn Lasgalen, the Wood of Greenleaves.'
'At the Narrows he met with Lord Celeborn of Lórien.'
'We shall divide the Mirkwood in three. Does claim of the Narrows befit the Woodmen?'
'Celeborn was travelling north with word of his people’s own victory at Dol Guldur.'
'The northern wood shall remain under my watch.'
'There at Laerlad they called a meeting between the Elves and the Woodmen.'
'We shall begin the long toil of restoring the woods to its former beauty. May the Woodmen prosper.'
'With that, the Woodmen departed. Celeborn and Thranduil had set into motion a great change for all in Rhovanion.'
'Radagast, why have you called us here?'
